data.title: Thunderbird Drone Festival
data.meta_description:

data.text:
We have exciting news as year #4 is back and better than ever!!!

The Thunderbird Drone Festival is soaring to new heights with the help of our friends at the Oklahoma State University's (OSU) Oklahoma Aerospace Institute for Research and Education and our friends at the Oklahoma Department of Aerospace and Aeronautics (ODAA). Thunderbird Drone Festival is moving to beautiful Oklahoma City!

Mark your calendars for October 4th and 5th, 2024, as the festival takes place at the OSU Tulsa Conference Center. Prepare yourself for a gravity-defying experience as we bring together the best in drone film/photography, cutting-edge technology, FPV drone racing, and educational opportunities.

This fourth annual event promises to be bigger and better than ever before. On day one, filmmakers and photographers from around the globe will gather to showcase their breathtaking drone work across various categories, judged by a panel of esteemed professionals, including Emmy award winners. The spectacular entries will leave you in awe, and the winners will be celebrated at an exclusive VIP after-party with a drone light show!

Day two will be packed with a range of engaging seminars, panels, and demos, diving deep into the fascinating world of drone technology. Don’t miss the thrilling FPV tiny-whoop races at the Sky-high Shootout, where speed and precision will be on full display!

This year’s Thunderbird Drone Festival in Oklahoma City is set to be an unforgettable event filled with innovation, creativity, and excitement. Join us on October 4-5, 2024, for the ultimate celebration of drone technology!

Partner: https://go.okstate.edu/aerospace/

Venue: OSU Tulsa Conference Center

700 N Greenwood Ave Tulsa, OK 74106

***Our website is currently undergoing updates for this year. So please bear with us as we fill in the information over the coming weeks!***

***Please ensure that you adhere to all local drone laws and regulations while participating in the Thunderbird Drone Festival. All drone pilots should operate their drones safely. The Thunderbird Drone Festival is not responsible for ensuring that pilots comply with their local drone laws.***

Submissions are now open and will close on August 23rd, 2024. Festival selections will be announced on or around September 6th, 2024. All entrants will be posted on our website, social media pages, and by email. If selected, exhibition format digital files will be requested from the filmmakers.

RULES:

Films must be 5 minutes in length or less (unless otherwise specified) and a majority of the footage must be shot using a drone or UAV (at least 50%).

All "Showreel & Commercial" entries must be 3 minutes or less (unless an exception is made).

All "Dronie" submissions must be less than 1 minute (unless an exception is made).

Submissions to the film festival must be made through FilmFreeway. The Festival Director reserves the right to make exceptions as needed.

LEGAL:

By submitting your project to the 2024 Thunderbird Drone Festival, you and anyone associated with the submitted project agree to the following terms:

- You authorize your project to be exhibited at the Thunderbird Drone Festival.

- You accept full legal responsibility for the intellectual property contained within your project.

- Your project does not infringe on any trademark, agreement, copyright, artistic, personal, civil, privacy, or moral rights of any person, firm, corporation, or association.

- In the event of any claim involving copyright, trademark, credits, publicity, screening, or loss of or damage to the submitted videos or photos, you agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Thunderbird Drone Festival from and against any resulting claims, liabilities, losses, damages, and expenses (including but not limited to attorney’s fees and court costs).

- Festival directors reserve the right to include or exclude films or photos as they see fit to keep the festival family-friendly.

- Festival directors reserve the right to adjust categories, the number of selected submissions, and the like in order to adhere to the schedule and confines of the festival.

- You authorize the use of your name, likeness, and submitted work in any promotion of the Thunderbird Drone Festival.
